decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Territorial Kavu, and Scion of Draco to pressure opponents. With powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames to remove threats, and Leyline cards to enhance creature abilities and protect them, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient creature beats and burn spells. The inclusion of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Arena of Glory adds additional versatility and resilience to the deck, allowing for multiple paths to victory and adapting to different matchups.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Combo by using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to tutor for Allosaurus Rider and other key creatures like Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. By ramping into big creatures like Generous Ent and Xenagos, God of Revels, the deck can quickly close out the game with powerful attacks. The inclusion of Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer helps protect the combo from disruption, while Consign to Memory and Planar Genesis provide additional utility and card advantage.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, supported by spells such as Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. The deck also includes ways to generate value and card advantage with cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The inclusion of Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment provides additional control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent quickly and close out the game before they can stabilize.

The main concept of the deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of removal spells, discard spells, and creatures that can exile or flicker enemy creatures. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's development while building up its own board presence to finish the game quickly. The deck also includes graveyard hate in the form of Relic of Progenitus and Ephemerate to deal with graveyard-based strategies. By disrupting the opponent's resources and controlling the board, the deck can overwhelm the opponent with efficient beatdown creatures.

The deck focuses on disruption and removal, using cards like Thoughtseize, Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Force of Negation to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes powerful finishers such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Sheoldred's Edict to win the game. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind them out with card advantage, while maintaining control over the game with counterspells and removal. It utilizes a mix of creature and spell-based threats to keep the opponent off balance and ultimately come out on top in the long game.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to control the game by removing threats, countering important spells, and out-valuing the opponent with card advantage. With powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent, as well as card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, the deck looks to grind out wins by controlling the board and outlasting the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo with Heliod, Spike Feeder, and Walking Ballista to create an infinite life gain and damage loop. It includes cards that support this combo such as Noble Hierarch and Collected Company, as well as disruptive elements like Skyclave Apparition and Ranger-Captain of Eos. The deck aims to quickly assemble its pieces while controlling the board with removal and disruption spells, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a powerful and resilient combo.

This deck focuses on using instant speed reanimator spells such as Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play from the graveyard. The deck also utilizes creatures with strong ETB effects like Solitude and Subtlety to control the board. By combining these instant reanimator elements with disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruption. The versatile land base allows for consistent mana fixing and smooth gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Flickerwisp and Solitude to remove threats and disrupt their board, while also using cards like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. Additionally, cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push help to control the board and eliminate threats efficiently. The deck aims to disrupt and control the game while ending it quickly with powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure through aggressive creatures. It utilizes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude to control the board, while also using disruptive spells like Thoughtseize. The deck also includes creatures with powerful abilities like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Emperor of Bones to apply pressure and close out games quickly. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive playstyle, allowing for consistent casting of spells and creatures.

The central theme of this deck is to utilize a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and outpace the opponent. By combining powerful cards like Solitude and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd with tools like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. The inclusion of cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp also adds a layer of versatility and tempo advantage to the deck, allowing for unexpected plays and opportunities to push for victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands to ramp up mana quickly and play big Eldrazi threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also includes control elements such as Devourer of Destiny and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Karn, the Great Creator is utilized to shut down artifacts and Ugin, Eye of the Storms provides additional control and removal options. The deck aims to overwhelm and outvalue the opponent with its efficient threats and disruptive spells.
